This is a great game for people who like first person shooter games, and loves to enjoy a rich and mysterious campaign experience. It doesn't require too much background knowledge of the past Bioshock franchise, as it is a unique and independent story. However, it does connect to the other two Bioshock games in a way. 

Player get to learn more about the truth of the story will the game moves forward, and many colourful characters and areas are also revealed. The game is also involved with time travelling and Parallel universe.

There are also many weapons and abilities to use, not going to SPOIL.

Last, it is definitely a game worth trying.

Bioshock Infinite: The best shooter I've...ever. If you thought Shutter Island or Interstellar screws with you...you haven't experienced Bioshock Infinite. Nuff' said, just go buy this game and play it.

The Good: Awesome characters Booker and Elizabeth are very well written, the atmosphere of Columbia is just...beautiful. 
 And last but not least...the story. My goodness...my review won't do it justice. Go play this game and also, buy the Burial at sea DLCs...please just do it.

The Bad: The game has an ending.

The story is kind of weak, this game is more focused on combat, finding weapons and learning different fighting techniques, but the vigors aren't nearly as useful as the plasmids were in the previous games, and the upgrade cost for weapons is too expensive, also the game ends too quickly (unless you want to farm for several hours to upgrade things), I finished in around 10 hours.
